content: the underarm using the backward loop method k1 raglan st knit 88 98 106 110 118 sts front k1 raglan st place the next 64 70 72 76 80 sts on a stitch holder left sleeve cast on 6 8 10 12 12 new sts for the underarm using the backward loop method k1 raglan st knit 44 49 53 55 59 sts left back there are now a total of 192 216 236 248 264 sts on the needle for the body work in the round in stockinette stitch until the sweater measures between 40-50 cm 15 7-19 6 inches or to the desired length measured mid back incl neck edge work 5-9 cm 2-3½ inches in 1x1 rib k1 p1 on a 3 mm us2 5 circular needle bind off by using your favourite method or see video on hunglish knitter youtube channel sleeves the sleeves are worked in the round on 4 mm us6 circular needle using the magic loop technique place stitches back on the needle the work begins where you pick up the new stitches in the two rounds set the pattern for the new stitches as follows round 1 pick up 6 8 10 12 12 sts along the sts that were cast on at the underarm on the body divide the work in half somewhere between two 7stcs lace pattern see video at hunglish knitter work the lace pattern to the beginning of round there are now a total of 70 78 82 88 92 sts on the needle round 2 work the new stitches into the lace pattern and additional 0 1 5 4 1 stitch purled at the under arm between two lace patterns the 7stcs lace pattern is repeated 10 11 11 12 13 times the work is set follow the lace pattern to the desired length above your elbow there are no decreases for short sleeve finish the sleeve in 1x1 rib k1 p1 knit the rib as wide as you wish in size small i knitted a 3 cm rib bind off by using your favourite method or see video on hunglish knitter youtube channel share your version of the hunglish lace tee on my instagram https //www instagram com/hunglishknitter/ happy knitting page 6 of 7 chart a s / m /l chart b xl / xxl page 7 of 7
